WorkItem.ClosedComment: I'm going to close this for the following reasons.a) This isnt a bug, its a feature request.b) This feature request doesnt have a practical application for anyone in their right mind.
WorkItem.Description: Just going through the Weapons list in Rarw, and I noticed that it never checks Polearms. My Druid is maxed out on the use of Polearms, is there a reason it does not check them also? Or is it an oversite?

Comments.Message: Sounds like you have the polearm item type refined out. Tools > Refine Types of Items Listed.
I already looked at that, and that box is grayed out and will not let me turn it on.
Err... Then you're either using a very very old version of Rawr, or not using the Bear/Cat model...? Does this happen with a brand new character?
Latest Version of Rawr, but yes, I am not using Bear/Cat models. I use the Moonkin Model, an I am 450/450 on polearms...
...then wtf do you want to use a polearm for? It has nothing to do with your polearm skill.
Seriously, please think before you post issues/discussions. Every utterly retarded thread that us devs have to respond to takes away time from actually working on Rawr.

Read the Question. It said, "Is there a reason it does not check them also?"  The right answer would have been to explain maybe why, and not try to cut people down. If this is the kind of responses you give people, how much more do you think they will even bother ask?  So in regards to my original question, I am guessing in your opinion, that a polearm will never be a usable weapon for a balanced druid, and that the benefits of a polearm while in the balance tree would not be useful.
Thanks Ted

It's not his opinion, it's a fact.  There never has been a spell power polearm worth using.  If, in some extraordinarily unlikely event, one does appear, I will add it to the list of usable items simply enough.  Until then, if you are trying to use a polearm as a moonkin, I'm going to call a spade a spade and say that you need more help than Rawr can give you.
I did not write the program, and if I did I would have included ALL aspects of the game so the end user could see there was no benefit. So with that said I would simply reply, "Not my oversight"
I hope people will continue to ask intelligent questions, and not waste our time with things like polearms for moonkin.

Question: "My Druid is maxed out on the use of Polearms, is there a reason it does not check them also?"
Answer: "Yes, there is a reason. It does not calculate Polearms, because that would be retarded."

fixed the title on this issue.
